conclusion: The v-t graph shows velocity as a function of time; slope gives acceleration.
From t = 1 to t = 2 seconds, the curve is concave down.
The slope of the tangent is decreasing, indicating decreasing acceleration.
At t = 1 second, the slope is positive and steep; it becomes less steep by t = 2 seconds.
Acceleration is positive but decreasing from t = 1 to t = 2 seconds.
Linear motion implies constant acceleration, which is not the case here.
The particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration.
Yes, it is correct to say the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
